hotspots.label: Bright Red Dewlap
hotspots.fact: This colorful fan-like skin under the lizard's chin is called a dewlap. Male lizards display their dewlaps to show they are strong and to communicate with other lizards in their territory.

hotspots.label: Textured Scales
hotspots.fact: The bumpy scales covering this lizard's body help protect it and blend in with rocks and trees. Each scale is made of keratin, the same material as your fingernails!

hotspots.label: Round Eye with Gold Iris
hotspots.fact: Lizards have excellent vision and can see in color. The golden-colored iris helps this lizard spot insects to eat and notice danger from predators nearby.

hotspots.label: Strong Legs and Claws
hotspots.fact: These muscular legs with sharp claws help lizards climb rocks and trees quickly. They can grip rough surfaces and escape from predators by scurrying away at fast speeds.
